todaysEvents.title: Salesforce Customer Data Breach via Gainsight Compromise
todaysEvents.description: Salesforce is investigating an incident where hackers compromised some of its customers' data after breaching customer experience company Gainsight. The hacking group ShinyHunters has reportedly claimed responsibility.

todaysEvents.title: Microsoft OS Infostealer Attack Vector
todaysEvents.description: A Microsoft update has created an agentic OS infostealer attack vector.

todaysEvents.title: Beckett Collectibles Data Breach & Website Defacement
todaysEvents.description: Beckett Collectibles experienced a data breach and website content defacement in November 2025. The stolen data was subsequently advertised for sale on a hacking forum and portions were publicly released.

todaysEvents.title: GANA Payment $3.1M+ Crypto Exploit
todaysEvents.description: The 'GANA Payment' project was exploited for approximately $3.1M+ on BSC. The attacker deposited 1140 BNB ($1.04M) to Tornado on BSC, bridged funds to Ethereum, and deposited another 346.8 ETH ($1.05M) to Tornado. An additional 346 ETH ($1.046M) currently remains dormant on Ethereum at address 0x7a503e3ab9433ebf13afb4f7f1793c25733b3cca.

todaysEvents.title: NAFFCO INC Ransomware Data Exfiltration
todaysEvents.description: NAFFCO INC was allegedly breached by a ransomware hacking group, which claims to have exfiltrated 1 TB of data including fiscal records, HR files, emails, budgets, strategic plans, and internal documents.

past7Days.briefing: This week saw a surge in high-impact cyber incidents across critical sectors, including finance, government, technology, and public services. Data breaches dominated the landscape, with major organizations such as DoorDash, Logitech, AT&T, Salesforce, and Beckett Collectibles reporting significant exposures of customer and internal data. The week also revealed sophisticated exploits, including active zero-days in Chrome and Oracle E-Business Suite, and multimillion-dollar cryptocurrency thefts through AI trading systems and payment platforms. Ransomware attacks, social engineering, and persistent scam activity compounded the threat environment, highlighting vulnerabilities in both technological infrastructure and human factors. The breadth and severity of these events underscore an urgent need for enhanced security controls, employee awareness, and rapid incident response capabilities.
past7Days.trends: The period was marked by a persistent rise in data breaches, with a notable concentration in tech, financial, and municipal organizations. Zero-day exploits and vulnerabilities in widely used platforms (Chrome, Oracle, Microsoft OS) are being actively targeted, suggesting an uptick in opportunistic attacks by well-resourced threat actors. Cryptocurrency-related crime remains elevated, with both scams and direct exploits resulting in substantial financial losses. Ransomware and extortion also resurfaced with high-profile attacks, while social engineering continues to trigger initial compromise events. Scam activity via social platforms (Telegram, Reddit) persists, emphasizing ongoing risks to individuals and businesses alike. Importantly, the overall threat scores trended upward midweek, with the highest scores coinciding with multi-vector, multi-incident days.
past7Days.predictions: In the coming days, expect continued targeting of major platforms and services via zero-day exploits and ransomware campaigns. Data breaches are likely to remain frequent, especially as attackers leverage recent vulnerabilities and social engineering tactics. Cryptocurrency platforms and fintech services will remain high-risk, with new scam schemes and direct exploits anticipated. The public sector and municipal entities should prepare for further phishing, third-party exploits, and citizen data exposures. Confidence in these predictions is high (80â€“90%), given the observed escalation in attack sophistication, the variety of impacted sectors, and ongoing news of exploit development. Organizations should prioritize patching critical systems, reinforce employee cybersecurity training, and monitor for abnormal network activity, as threat actors will likely capitalize on recent successful tactics.
